It‚Äôs been a busy week, and we‚Äôre continuing to make progress for all Iowans. Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve been working on delivering for Iowa.

There‚Äôs no way to sugar coat it: Washington‚Äôs budget process is broken. In order to #MakeEmSqueal and rein in government spending, we need to change the way things are done in the DC swamp. If we refuse to hold ourselves accountable in congress, how can we expect our agencies and contractors to hold themselves responsible. My MAKE CENTS act would: Increase transparency in government spending by requiring a public price tag for every federal project, and an annual report listing every project that is more than $1 billion over budget or 5 years behind schedule. End use-it-or-lose-it budgeting that incentivizes waste at the end of the fiscal year Stop Congress from going on recess if they haven‚Äôt approved a budget and passed all appropriations bills Hold Congressmembers‚Äô salaries if we fail to pass a budget

Every day is a great day to celebrate Iowa, but today is #NationalIowaDay! To celebrate I wanted to share a few fun facts about our amazing state.  To kick things off -Iowa has the longest serving Governor in the history of America, the great Terry Branstad. First Lady Lou Henry Hoover was born in Waterloo in 1874. She was the first First Lady to make regular radio broadcasts and is still the only First Lady to have been fluent in an Asian language. She was also the first woman in America to earn a degree in geology from Stanford. Growing up, former Tonight Show host Johnny Carson lived in Corning, Avoca, Clarinda and my hometown of Red Oak. Correctionville got its name because that is where land surveyors adjusted (or corrected) their survey lines for the curvature of the Earth. It has nothing to do with a prison, nor is there a local correctional facility. Iowans are known for our service defending America, and during World War II, the Des Moines Ordnance Plant in Ankeny manufactured up to nearly four billion bullets. The site of that plant is now the John Deere Des Moines Works. Strawberry Point is the home of America's largest strawberry! There are more hogs in Iowa than there are people in New York City (the jokes write themselves). There are more chickens in Iowa than people in Texas and California COMBINED. Cornell College is one of only two schools in the country that has its entire campus on the National Register of Historic Places. My alma mater Iowa State was the first land grant college in the country. Go Clones!  We all know Iowa feeds and fuels the world, but did you know 92% of land in Iowa is farmland? And finally, riding through our beautiful countryside is one of the best things about our state, so it‚Äôs no surprise Iowa has the third highest motorcycle ownership in the country. Have a great National Iowa Day!

When it comes to my plan to protect survivors of sexual assault and domestic abuse, as well as President Trump's #USMCANow trade deal, we're seeing Democrat obstruction that defies common sense. Both of these plans are common sense and should have wide bipartisan support. My plan triples rape prevention and education resources, addresses female genital mutilation, bolsters rural housing protections for victims, puts stricter penalties on child sexual abuse, and more. The USMCA would deliver big wins for farmers, businesses, and workers by strengthening and modernizing our trading relationships with Mexico and Canada. So why are Democrats in the House and Senate holding things up? Democrats are putting politics ahead of the people. I‚Äôm frustrated, but I‚Äôm not giving up.
